choices.A: When a new workstation connects to port F0/1
choices.D: When the switch loses power and reboots
choices.C: When 61 percent of the Address table capacity is used
choices.E: When the phone previously on Fa0/2 is now connect to Fa0/5
choices.B: When 61 MAC address are in the switch

questions.question_text:
Refer to exhibit, which two statements correctly indicate when an SNMP trap is set to the switch? (Choose two.)
//IMG//
What is the command for configuring root guard?

discussion.content:
Cat-IOS#(config)# interface fastethernet 3/1
Cat-IOS#(config-if)# spanning-tree guard root

choices.A: you should configure remote vlan first
choices.B: use different vlan for multiple/different switches

questions.question_text: What is cisco recommendation for RSPAN best practice?

discussion.content:
"We recommend that you configure an RSPAN VLAN before you configure an RSPAN source or a destination session."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3750e_3560e/software/release/12-2_55_se/configuration/guide/3750escg/swspan.pdf

If Cisco missed the word "untagged' somewhere,the answer should be A.

To maintain the tagging on the native VLAN and drop untagged traffic, use the vlan dot1q tag native command. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/m/en_us/techdoc/dc/reference/cli/nxos/commands/l2/vlan-dot1q-tag-native.html

questions.question_text: What happens if you apply this command "vlan dot1q tag native"?

discussion.content:
Dynamic ARP inspection is a security feature that validates ARP packets in a network. It intercepts, logs,
and discards ARP packets with invalid IP-to-MAC address bindings. This capability protects the network
from certain man-in-the-middle attacks.
